questions.question: In the context of blockchain, what is the primary objective of a consensus mechanism?

answers.c: Ensuring all nodes agree on the validity and order of transactions.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the primary function of the Proof of Work consensus mechanism in blockchain networks like Bitcoin?

answers.a: Validators are chosen based on the number of coins they pledge as collateral.
answers.b: Transactions are approved through a voting mechanism based on coin ownership.
answers.c: Participants must complete specific computational challenges to validate and add new blocks.
answers.d: Validators are pre-selected based on their reputation and identity

questions.question: In a Proof of Stake blockchain consensus mechanism, how are validators typically chosen to create a new block?

answers.a: By solving complex cryptographic puzzles first.
answers.b: Based on the number of coins they commit as collateral.
answers.c: Based on a rotational system where every node gets a turn.
answers.d: Through a voting system where nodes vote for their favorite validator.
